Outcome Statement: The system allows providers to have near real-time access to a Medicaid beneficiary's prescription drug history, number and type of controlled substances prescribed and filled, and contact information of each provider who prescribed a controlled substance to the covered individual.
Regulatory Sources: Section 1944 (b)(1) of the Social Security Act1, as added by the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act ('Medicaid PARTNERSHIP Act, Public Law 115–271)

Metric: Time to Produce Drug History Report

Outcome Statement: The PDMP system allows providers to easily use the PDMP information through workflow integration, which may include electronic prescribing systems for controlled substances.
Regulatory Sources: Section 1944 (b)(2) of the Social Security Act1, as added by the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act ('Medicaid PARTNERSHIP Act,' Public Law 115–271)
Metric: Rate of PDMP Integration with EHRs

Outcome Statement: The state has data-sharing agreements with all contiguous states to track patients, prescribers, and prescriptions across state lines.
Regulatory Sources: Section 1944 (f)(2) of the Social Security Act1, as added by the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act ('Medicaid PARTNERSHIP Act,' Public Law 115–271)
Metric: Proportion of Contiguous States with Active Data-Sharing Agreements

Outcome Statement: If the state allows PDMP access to Medicaid medical and pharmacy directors or their designees, the system allows such staff to access the information in an electronic format based on data-sharing agreements in place.
Regulatory Sources: Section 1944 (b) of the Social Security Act, as added by the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act ('Medicaid PARTNERSHIP Act,' Public Law 115–271)

Outcome Statement: The PDMP system enables 1) the state to produce the Drug Utilization Review (DUR) Annual Report, including information about data breaches, and 2) the State Medicaid Drug Utilization Review (DUR) Board to review claims data and submit reports to HHS, when applicable, after a controlled substance prescription has been dispensed to identify patterns of fraud, abuse, gross overuse, medically unnecessary care, and implementation of corrective action(s).
Metric: Total Number of Fraud, Waste, and Abuse Cases Referred
